intro: Cypholophus patens, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and prefers well-draining soil. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and bloom throughout the year in suitable conditions. Cypholophus patens is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
